question: Which country's UNESCO World Heritage Site is "Kunta Kinteh Island and Related Sites"?
explanation: Kunta Kinteh Island and Related Sites are the UNESCO World Heritage Site of the Gambia. Kunta Kinteh Island, formerly called James Island and St Andrew's Island, is an island in the Gambia River, located in the country of the Gambia. James Island and Related Sites present a testimony to the main periods and facets of the encounter between Africa and Europe along the River Gambia, a continuum stretching from pre-colonial and pre-slavery times to independence. The site is particularly significant for its relation to the beginning of the slave trade and its abolition. It also documents early access to the interior of Africa.
